    • Method Detail

      • initialize

        public void initialize(java.net.URL url,
                       java.util.ResourceBundle rb)
        This method initialize the animation when the game starts to run. It loads the FXML files with FXMLLoader and the controller class will be instantiated by the FXMLLoader.
        Specified by:
        initialize in interface javafx.fxml.Initializable
        Parameters:
        url - The location used to resolve relative paths for the root object, or null if the location is not known.
        rb - The resources used to localize the root object, or null if the root object was not localized.

      • handleNewGameBoard

        public void handleNewGameBoard()
        This method handles new board from user

      • initCanvasListeners

        private void initCanvasListeners()
        Initializes the canvas listeners. Redraws canvas if height or width changes

      • initMouseHandlers

        private void initMouseHandlers()
        Method that initializes the mouse event handlers for the game board and handles the clicking on the board Reads the MouseEvent x and y value and translates it to a position in the array, flips the value and calls the draw method. If the board has less than 200 rows it draws grid lines as well
        See Also:
        MouseEvent

      • draw

        private void draw()
        A new, optimized draw()-method that only draws what is visible inside the viewport. This new and optimized draw method was based on the pair programmed first version, but I've added logic for handling grid offset and optimized the speed by not drawing the dead cells.

      • drawGridLines

        private void drawGridLines(javafx.scene.canvas.GraphicsContext gc)
        This method draws grid lines on the canvas
        Parameters:
        gc - The canvas' GraphicsContext

      • handlePlayButton

        private void handlePlayButton(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)

        Parameters:
        event - the event that runs the generations indefinite or pause the game
